page.title: First Orion UI Documentation
page.description: Find all the information you need to get started with First Orion UI.

tabs.name: Getting Started
tabs.description: Get started with First Orion UI by exploring the documentation, examples, and API references. This section provides a comprehensive guide to help you understand the framework and its components.

tabs.name: Examples
tabs.description: A collection of examples demonstrating the usage of First Orion UI components.

children.name: Accordion Example
children.description: This is an example of an accordion component. It allows you to expand and collapse sections of content.

componentData.name: Accordion
componentData.description: An accordion component that allows for expandable and collapsible sections.

props.name: primary
props.description: If true, the accordion will be primary color.

children.name: Alert Example
children.description: Alert example demonstrates the usage of the alert component. It showcases how to create alerts with different types, such as success, error, and warning.

componentData.name: Alert
componentData.description: An alert component that displays a message to the user.

children.name: Button Example
children.description: Button example demonstrates the usage of different button types and their functionalities. It showcases how to create buttons with various styles, sizes, and actions.

componentData.name: Button
componentData.description: A button component that triggers an action when clicked.

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the button. Can be 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', or 'xl'.

props.name: variant
props.description: The variant of the button. Can be 'primary', 'secondary', or 'soft'.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the button will be disabled and not clickable.

props.name: loading
props.description: If true, a loading spinner will be shown inside the button.

props.name: submit
props.description: If true, the button will be of type 'submit'.

props.name: on-click
props.description: A function to be called when the button is clicked.

children.name: Checkbox Example
children.description: Checkbox example demonstrates the usage of the checkbox component. It showcases how to create a simple checkbox that allows you to select or deselect an option.

componentData.name: Checkbox
componentData.description: A simple checkbox component that allows you to select or deselect an option.

props.name: checked
props.description: If true, the checkbox will be checked.

props.name: label
props.description: The label of the checkbox.

props.name: description
props.description: A description for the checkbox, displayed below the label.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the checkbox will be disabled.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback function when the checkbox state changes.

children.name: Counter Example - Advanced
children.description: This is an example of a counter component. It allows you to increment and decrement a value.

componentData.name: Counter
componentData.description: A simple counter component that allows you to increment and decrement a value.

props.name: primary
props.description: If true, the counter will be primary color.

props.name: owner
props.description: The owner of the counter.

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the counter.

children.name: Counter Example - Basic
children.description: This example demonstrates a simple counter application using the First Orion UI framework. It showcases the basic functionality of incrementing and decrementing a counter value.

componentData.name: Counter
componentData.description: A simple counter component that allows you to increment and decrement a value.

props.name: primary
props.description: If true, the counter will be primary color.

props.name: owner
props.description: The owner of the counter.

props.name: title
props.description: The title of the counter.

children.name: Dropdown Example
children.description: This example demonstrates a simple counter application using the First Orion UI framework. It showcases the basic functionality of incrementing and decrementing a counter value.

componentData.name: Dropdown
componentData.description: A simple dropdown component that allows you to select an option from a list.

props.name: primary
props.description: If true, the counter will be primary color.

props.name: label
props.description: The label of the dropdown.

props.name: options
props.description: The options for the dropdown.

props.name: selectedOption
props.description: The selected option of the dropdown.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback function when the selected option changes.

children.name: Input Example
children.description: Input example demonstrates the usage of the input component. It showcases how to create different types of inputs, such as text, password, and email.

children.name: Select Example
children.description: Select example demonstrates the usage of the select component. It showcases how to create a dropdown with various options and handle selection changes.

componentData.name: Select
componentData.description: A simple dropdown component that allows you to select an option from a list.

props.name: options
props.description: The options for the dropdown.

props.name: selectedOption
props.description: The currently selected option of the dropdown.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback function when the selected option changes.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text displayed when no option is selected.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the dropdown will be disabled.

children.name: Textarea Example
children.description: Textarea example demonstrates the usage of the textarea component. It showcases how to create a simple textarea that allows you to input multi-line text.

componentData.name: Textarea
componentData.description: A simple textarea component that allows you to input multi-line text.

props.name: value
props.description: The current value of the textarea.

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder text displayed when the textarea is empty.

props.name: rows
props.description: Number of visible text lines for the textarea.

props.name: cols
props.description: Number of visible character columns for the textarea.

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the textarea will be disabled.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback function when the value of the textarea changes.

props.name: autoResize
props.description: If true, the textarea will automatically adjust its height based on the content.

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum number of characters allowed in the textarea.

children.name: Toggle Example
children.description: Toggle example demonstrates the usage of the toggle component. It showcases how to create a simple toggle switch that allows you to toggle between two states.

componentData.name: Toggle
componentData.description: A simple toggle switch component that allows you to toggle between two states.

props.name: primary
props.description: If true, the counter will be primary color.

props.name: label
props.description: The label of the dropdown.

props.name: options
props.description: The options for the dropdown.

props.name: selectedOption
props.description: The selected option of the dropdown.

props.name: onChange
props.description: Callback function when the selected option changes.
